T1591: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's organization that can be used during targeting
T1615: Adversaries may gather information on Group Policy settings to identify paths for privilege escalation, security measures applied within a domain, and to discover patterns in domain objects that can be manipulated or used to blend in the environment
T1200: Adversaries may introduce computer accessories, networking hardware, or other computing devices into a system or network that can be used as a vector to gain access
T1564: Adversaries may attempt to hide artifacts associated with their behaviors to evade detection
T1574: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the way operating systems run programs
T1562: Adversaries may maliciously modify components of a victim environment in order to hinder or disable defensive mechanisms
T1656: Adversaries may impersonate a trusted person or organization in order to persuade and trick a target into performing some action on their behalf
T1525: Adversaries may implant cloud or container images with malicious code to establish persistence after gaining access to an environment
T1070: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts generated within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses
T1202: Adversaries may abuse utilities that allow for command execution to bypass security restrictions that limit the use of command-line interpreters
T1105: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment
T1490: Adversaries may delete or remove built-in data and turn off services designed to aid in the recovery of a corrupted system to prevent recovery
T1056: Adversaries may use methods of capturing user input to obtain credentials or collect information
T1559: Adversaries may abuse inter-process communication (IPC) mechanisms for local code or command execution
T1534: Adversaries may use internal spearphishing to gain access to additional information or exploit other users within the same organization after they already have access to accounts or systems within the environment
T1570: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files between systems in a compromised environment
T1654: Adversaries may enumerate system and service logs to find useful data
T1036: Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools
